content:
• Thursday, January 10, 2019
  • PVH

    PVH +5% as Q4, FY 2018 earnings seen beating guidance

    • PVH Corp. (NYSE:PVH) +5.1% after-hours as it expects Q4 EPS of at least $1.75, $0.15 above the high end of company guidance announced in November and the analyst consensus estimate.
    • PVH sees Q4 revenues of at least $2.4B, in-line with the $2.39B analyst consensus.
    • For FY 2018, PVH expects EPS of at least $9.50 and revenues of at least $9.57B, both higher than the company's previous expectations.
    • PVH also says it expects to incur ~$120M in pre-tax costs over the next 12 months related to the Calvin Klein restructuring.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM
  • CRBP

    ATVI, CGC, OCUL and STLD among notable after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: CRBP +9.2%. SNX +5.8%. PVH +5.1%. STLD +4.3%. OCUL +2.5%.
    • Top Losers: AEH -21.9%. ATVI -6.7%. PCG -5.9%. CGC -2.5%. PEN -2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM | 9 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing, Embraer announce Brazil government approval of 80-20 JV

    • Boeing (NYSE:BA) and Embraer (NYSE:ERJ) say Brazil's government has approved their strategic partnership that will be 80% owned by the U.S. company and 20% by the Brazilian firm; ERJ +4.6% after-hours.
    • Under the deal terms, ERJ will sell 80% of its commercial aircraft division, its most profitable, for $4.2B.
    • The tie-up still must be approved by shareholders and regulators, but winning the backing of Brazil’s government was considered the biggest hurdle.
    • The companies also agree to the terms of another JV, owned 51% by ERJ and 49% by BA, to promote and develop new markets for Boeing's KC-390 multi-mission medium airlift.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM | 11 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix +1.6% as UBS raises to Buy

    • Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is up 1.6% after hours on solid volume after an upgrade to Buy at UBS.
    • The firm's Eric Sheridan ticked up his price target on shares to $410, from $400.
    • That implies 26.3% upside from today's close; shares also moved up 1.5% during today's regular session.
    • Netflix reports earnings on Jan. 17 (next Thursday); it's expected to post EPS of $0.25 on revenues of $4.21B.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 39 Comments
  • ATVI

    Stephens starts bullish coverage on videogame makers

    • A launch of videogame-company coverage by Stephens is leaning bullishly on the sector's big dogs.
    • The firm initiated big publishers Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI), Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) and Take-Two Interactive Software (NASDAQ:TTWO) at Overweight. Also joining those three at Overweight is mobile-focused developer Glu Mobile (NASDAQ:GLUU).
    • It's set a price target for Activision of $65, implying 27% upside; a target for Electronic Arts of $125, implying 37% upside; and a price target for Take-Two of $138, implying 25% upside. A GLUU target of $10.50 implies 16% upside.
    • Meanwhile, Stephens started coverage on Ubisoft (OTCPK:UBSFY) and Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) at Equal Weight. Its Ubisoft target of €75 implies 3.6% downside, while a target of $4.75 on Zynga implies 11% upside.
    • After hours: ATVI -6.6%; EA +0.3%; TTWO +0.2%; GLUU flat; ZNGA -0.2%.
    • Previously: Activision -1.6% as it transfers 'Destiny' rights to Bungie (Jan. 10 2019)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 33 Comments
  • PCG

    PG&E -8% as Moody's joins S&P in cutting credit rating

    • PG&E (NYSE:PCG) -7.9% after-hours as Moody's downgrades PG&E Corp. to B2 from Baa3 and Pacific Power & Gas to B from BBB-, with ratings remaining on review for another potential downgrade.
    • The ratings firm cites a challenging environment for the California utility as potential liabilities grow, liquidity reserves decline and access to capital grows more uncertain.
    • Earlier this week, S&P cut its rating on PG&E and its Pacific Power & Gas unit to B from BBB-, the lowest tier of investment-grade ratings.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 29 Comments
  • SNX

    Synnex +5% on Q4 beats, upside guide

    • Synnex (NYSE:SNX) gains 5% aftermarket on Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 6% Y/Y revenue growth.
    • Upside Q1 guidance has revenue of $5.225B to $5.425B (consensus: $5.01B) and EPS of $2.70 to $2.80 (consensus: $2.52).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Synnex declares $0.375 dividend (Jan. 10)
    • Previously: Synnex beats by $0.55, beats on revenue (Jan. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • AGRX

    Agile Therapeutics advancing Twirla, to refile U.S. marketing application next quarter

    • Agile Therapeutics (NASDAQ:AGRX) announces that it expects to complete the comparative wear study aimed at demonstrating non-inferiority of contraceptive patch Twirla to Xulane this quarter followed by its resubmitted marketing application in Q2.
    • The company received a second CRL two years ago citing concerns with in vivo adhesion.
    • Previously: Agile strikes out again on U.S. OK of contraceptive patch Twirla (Dec. 22, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 5 Comments
  • ATVI

    Activision -1.6% as it transfers 'Destiny' rights to Bungie (updated)

    • Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI) is off 1.6% postmarket following an SEC filing that notes that game developer Bungie will own and develop the Destiny franchise from here.
    • Bungie developed the game with Activision as publisher for a September 2014 release; it sold through $325M at retail in its first five days of release.
    • Now Bungie will assume full publishing rights and responsibilities, according to the filing.
    • That means "the company does not expect to recognize material revenue, operating income or operating loss from the Destiny franchise in 2019," Activision says.
    • Updated 4:27 p.m.: Shares are now down 6.8% on robust postmarket volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 49 Comments
  • SNX

    Synnex beats by $0.55, beats on revenue

    • Synnex (NYSE:SNX): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $3.65 beats by $0.55; GAAP EPS of $2.41 beats by $0.17.
    • Revenue of $5.62B (+5.8% Y/Y) beats by $200M.
    • Shares +4.32%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 6 Comments
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers slumps to 52-week low

    • Weight Watchers International (WTW -2.7%) fell to a 52-week low of $34.82 earlier in the session today amid broad selling pressure in the retail sector.
    • The company isn't due to report earnings until the end of February, when an update on subscriber growth during the key diet season can be expected.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 9 Comments
  • PRQR

    Selloff continues in ProQR Therapeutics, shares down 9%

    • Thinly traded micro cap ProQR Therapeutics (PRQR -8.5%) is down on almost double normal volume. Shares have retreated ~30% this week in apparent response to its timeline for sepofarsen (QR-110) for the treatment of a certain type of Leber’s congenital amaurosis 10 (LCA10), an inherited disorder that causes childhood blindness.
    • On Monday, it announced that the FDA signed off on the design of a 30-subject Phase 2/3 clinical trial, ILLUMINATE, in LCA10 sufferers who harbor a mutation in the CEP290 gene called p.Cys998X. The primary endpoint will be the change from baseline in visual acuity compared to control at month 12.
    • Patients in the control arm will have the option to cross over to active treatment. All participants will continue to receive sepofarsen for another 12 months. Topline data should be available by year-end 2020.
    • Another factor that may be depressing shares is the longer-term safety profile of PQ-110-001, in Phase 1/2 development for the same patient population. 11 patients have been dosed thus far. Two developed cystoid macular edema which responded to standard-of-care treatment and six experienced lens opacities, three who had their corrective lenses replaced. The events were determined to be likely related to PQ-110-001. There were no discontinuations.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 3 Comments
  • SPN

    Superior Energy, Keane cut at Jefferies as oil services firms 'worth less'

    • Superior Energy Services (SPN -5.5%) and Keane Group (FRAC -1.5%) are sharply lower following downgrades from Jefferies, which says both companies are "vulnerable to more earnings erosion."
    • Oil services and equipment companies generally are "worth less than historically," says Jefferies analyst Brad Handler, and investors should look to "sell into strength as estimate cuts enter their fifth year," as challenges to the duration and magnitude of the upcycle are "too apparent."
    • Handler downgrades SPN to Underperform from Hold and slashes its price target to $3 from $4.50, and cuts FRAC to Hold from Buy with a $10 target trimmed from $12.
    • The firm's favorites in the sector are Baker Hughes (BHGE +1%), Helmerich & Payne (HP +1%) and Apergy (APY -1.4%), as each has distinct growth potential, generate cash and have low or manageable debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 6 Comments
  • TRCO

    CNBC: Tegna, Hearst, Scripps vying for Cox TV stations

    • Final bids are due Jan. 30 for Cox's 14 broadcast TV stations, and Tegna (TGNA +1.4%), Hearst and E.W. Scripps (SSP +0.3%) are all expected to be in the mix, CNBC reports.
    • Those stations -- including broadcast affiliates in Atlanta, Boston and Orlando among others -- are expected to draw a price tag of more than $2B and maybe close to $3B.
    • Nexstar (NXST +1.8%), a previous potential bidder, bowed out after its own $4.1B deal for Tribune Media (NYSE:TRCO).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • TXMD

    Invexxy launch results buoy TherapeuticsMD, up 11%

    • TherapeuticsMD (TXMD +10.7%) is up on below-average volume following yesterday's corporate presentation at #JPM19. Highlights:
    • Commercial launch of Imvexxy (estradiol vaginal inserts) began in August 2018. Through December 31, ~62.4K paid prescriptions have been dispensed to ~25.5K patients. 62% of eligible patients have filled their 4th prescription. Average of 2.3 fills per patient.
    • Bijuva (estradiol and progesterone) to be launched next quarter for the treatment of menopause-related hot flashes followed by contraceptive Annovera (segesterone acetate/ethinyl estradiol vaginal system) in H2.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 13 Comments
  • RL

    Needham upgrades Ralph Lauren

    • Needham upgrades Ralph Lauren (NYSE:RL) to a Buy rating after having the apparel stock set at Hold.
    • The firm sees Ralph Lauren as leaner and more nimble than before, a development which is expected to lead to margin improvement.
    • Needham sets a price target of $122 on Ralph Lauren.
    • Shares of RL are down 2.4% amid a broad downturn in the retail sector today.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • INPX

    SFUN, VERI and MTLS among tech movers

    • Gainers: Inpixon (NASDAQ:INPX) +34%. Fang Holdings (NYSE:SFUN) +28%. Aehr Test Systems (NASDAQ:AEHR) +21%. CooTek (NYSE:CTK) +16%. Veritone (NASDAQ:VERI) +13%.
    • Losers: Gridsum Holding (NASDAQ:GSUM) -19%. MongoDB (NASDAQ:MDB) -14%. Materialise NV (NASDAQ:MTLS) -14%. FTE Networks (NYSEMKT:FTNW) -12%. OptimizeRx (NASDAQ:OPRX) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM

  • Oil logs longest rally in nearly 10 years

    • WTI crude isn't up a lot today, but it is up 0.6%. That marks the 9th consecutive session of gains - the longest winning streak in about nine years, according to Marketwatch.
    • The streak has taken oil from about $46 per barrel to the current $52.70.
    • The move, of course, coincides with a notable softening in the Fed's hawkish tone and a major rally in nearly all risk assets.
    • The Fed was back at it today, with numerous central bankers more or less saying the rate hike cycle is officially over (or at least a long pause).
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UWT, UCO, DWT, SCO, BNO, DBO, UGA, DTO, USL, DNO, OLO, UHN, SZO, OLEM, WTIU, OILK, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, OILD, OILU, USAI
    • Previously: Fed's Bullard - Last rate hike an "overreach" (Jan. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 23 Comments
  • AZUL

    Morgan Stanley bullish on Azul

    • Morgan Stanley launches coverage on Azul (AZUL +2.1%) with an Overweight rating.
    • The firm calls the carrier its favorite Brazilian airline stock.
    • The MS price target of $36 on Azul is above the 52-week high of $35.05.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • ACAD

    Acadia Pharma +6% after conference presentation

    • Presenting last night at #JPM19, Acadia Pharmaceutical (ACAD +5.9%) noted the significant commercial opportunity for Nuplazid, its treatment for dementia-related psychosis in Parkinson's sufferers.
    • Presentation slides here
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 5 Comments
  • SAEX

    SAExploration and Ferroglobe among Energy/Materials gainers; Phunware and Key Energy Services among losers

    • Gainers: SAExploration (NASDAQ:SAEX) +16%. Ferroglobe (NASDAQ:GSM) +8%. Emerge Energy Services (NYSE:EMES) +7%. Superior Drilling Products (NYSEMKT:SDPI) +6%. Lilis Energy (NYSEMKT:LLEX) +5%.
    • Losers: Phunware (NASDAQ:PHUN) -60%. Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) -16%. Hornbeck Offshore Services (NYSE:HOS) -10%. Sundance Energy Australia (NASDAQ:SNDE) -10%. Camber Energy (NYSEMKT:CEI) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • XYF

    X Financial leads financial gainers; eXp World Holdings and Hexindai among losers

    • Gainers: X Financial (NYSE:XYF) +14%. Forestar Group (NYSE:FOR) +7%. EverQuote (NASDAQ:EVER) +7%. Leju Holdings (NYSE:LEJU) +5%. Hunt Companies Finance Trust (NYSE:HCFT) +5%.
    • Losers: Wins Finance Holdings (NASDAQ:WINS) -32%. eXp World Holdings (NASDAQ:EXPI) -7%. Hexindai (NASDAQ:HX) -6%. 360 Finance (NASDAQ:QFIN) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • ROKU

    Roku -2.5% following Amazon free-streaming news

    • Roku (NASDAQ:ROKU) is down 2.5% and back near session lows following news that Amazon.com's IMDb has launched a Roku-like free streaming channel for movies and TV.
    • While Freedive is available on IMDb's site, its key linked devices are in Amazon's Fire TV system.
    • That's an interesting wrinkle in that while Roku has a heavy share of viewing hours among connected-TV platforms, and one in four smart TVs last year were licensed Roku TVs, Needham pointed out that four of the top five televisions sold on Amazon are Roku sets.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 28 Comments
  • INPX

    Microcaps dominate midday movers

    • Gainers: Inpixon (NASDAQ:INPX) +42%. PLx Pharma (NASDAQ:PLXP) +31%. Novan (NASDAQ:NOVN) +24%. AgeX Therapeutics (NYSEMKT:AGE) +22%. 500.com (NYSE:WBAI) +25%. Fang Holdings (NYSE:SFUN) +22%. Veritone (NASDAQ:VERI) +19%. CooTek (NYSE:CTK) +17%. SAExploration Holdings (NASDAQ:SAEX) +17%. Amarin Corporation (NASDAQ:AMRN) +16%.
    • Losers: Wins Finance Holdings (NASDAQ:WINS) -32%. Miragen Therapeutics (NASDAQ:MGEN) -21%. Macy's (NYSE:M) -19%. e.l.f. Beauty (NYSE:ELF) -16%. Atossa Genetics (NASDAQ:ATOS) -15%. Materialise NV (NASDAQ:MTLS) -14%. PAVmed (NASDAQ:PAVM) -14%. Hornbeck Offshore Services (NYSE:HOS) -13%. PHI (NASDAQ:PHII) -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • BA

    Lockheed cut at Morgan Stanley alongside bullish view of Boeing, Raytheon

    • Boeing (BA +2.1%) is higher after Morgan Stanley upgraded shares to Overweight from Equal Weight, but Lockheed Martin (LMT +1.9%) also rises even as Stanley also downgrades LMT to Equal Weight from Overweight with a $300 price target, cut from $366.
    • LMT's ramping production of the F-35 fighter jet and the re-establishment of the F-16 give the company a clear growth trajectory into 2020 and beyond, Stanley analyst Rajeev Lalwani says.
    • But LMT faces headwinds related to its pension program, Lalwani says, as increased contributions of $1.5B/year are set to begin and the company receives $2.5B in recoveries from the U.S. government that will be cut to hundreds of millions due to recouped contributions.
    • The firm considers Raytheon (RTN -0.1%) its top pick in the defense sector, as RTN oversees one of the best product portfolios in the group and the company's 30% international exposure best positions it if defense spending is cut in the coming year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 17 Comments
  • PLXP

    PLx Pharma up 26%

    • Thinly traded nano cap PLx Pharma (PLXP +25.5%) is up almost a 4x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 113K shares, adding to a rally that began on December 27, 2018. The stock has quadrupled since that day's intrasession low of $1.00.
    • During the company's Q3 earnings call on November 9, CEO Natasha Giordano reported that the company had confirmed a new supplier for a key ingredient in lead product Vazalore, a liquid-filled aspirin capsule. The manufacturing of development-scale batches and the preparation of an FDA pre-submission briefing packet should be happening this quarter.
    • A Type C meeting with the FDA should happen next quarter, followed by the completion of registration batches in Q3 and an sNDA submission in Q4. If all goes well, market launch will commence mid-2020.
    • On the working capital front, it had $16.5M in cash and equivalents at the end of Q3 2018 while operations consumed $7.2M during the first three quarters of the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • BTC-USD

    Crypto market tumbles

    • A quiet few weeks in cryptocurrencies has ended today, with heavy selling across the board.
    • Bitcoin (BTC-USD) -10% to $3,660, Ether (ETH-USD) -16% to $127, Bitcoin Cash -16% to $134, Stellar (XLM-USD) -15% to $0.1056, Ripple (XRP-USD) -11.5% to $0.3290, Litecoin (LTC-USD) -15% to $33.
    • OTCQX:GBTC -10.2%
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 141 Comments
  • IP

    Packaging stocks break higher

    • Containerboard/paper/packaging stocks are tracking higher today after some hiccups earlier this week following downgrades.
    • Traders are said to be warming up to valuation on certain names due to the share price drops.
    • Gainers include International Paper (IP +2.7%), Packaging Corporation of America (PKG +2.6%), WestRock (WRK +3.2%), Graphic Packaging Holding (GPK +3.3%), Berry Global (BERY +2.7%), Domtar (UFS +2.8%), Clearwater (CLW +3.1%), Greif (GEF +2.8%) and Sealed Air (SEE +2.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 9 Comments
  • NHTC

    Constellation Brands and Orchids Paper Products among consumer gainers; Fossil Group and Deckers Outdoor among losers

    • Gainers: Natural Health Trends (NASDAQ:NHTC) +11%. Orchids Paper Products (NYSEMKT:TIS) +8%. VOXX International (NASDAQ:VOXX) +8%. Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) +6%.
    • Losers: e.l.f. Beauty (NYSE:ELF) -16%. Fossil Group (NASDAQ:FOSL) -9%. Xcel Brands (NASDAQ:XELB) -8%. Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) -7%. G-III Apparel (NASDAQ:GIII) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 4 Comments
  • ASMB

    Assembly Bio advancing studies of HBV candidate ABI-H0731; investors unmoved, shares down 17% this week

    • Thinly traded micro cap Assembly Biosciences (ASMB -10%) is down on double normal volume. Shares have retreated 22% since touching the intraday high of $25.68 on Monday and are down 17% for the week.
    • Investors appear to be disappointed with the chronology for HBV candidate ABI-H0731. Two clinical trials, '201 and '202, have completed enrollment. At the end of six months, participants will have the option to rollover into an open-label study evaluating the combination of ABI-H0731 and nucleoside/tide therapy and continue treatment for up to another year. The company says the data will inform timelines and registration strategies.
    • Phase 1 data on another candidate, ABI-2158, should be available in H1.
    • A third, ABI-H3733, should enter the clinic this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • PHUN

    Phunware awarded patent

    • Phunware (PHUN +18.7%) has been granted U.S. Patent No. 10,038,972, Monitoring Outdoor and Indoor Regions with Mobile Devices.
    • The patent adds to Phunware’s growing IP portfolio of 13 patents and 6 patents-pending.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 10 Comments
  • RFL

    Rafael Holdings up 12% after U.S. Orphan Drug tag for devimistat

    • Thinly traded micro cap Rafael Holdings (RFL +12.1%) is up on a 13x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 186K shares, on the heels of FDA Orphan Drug status for Rafael Pharmaceuticals' CPI-613 (devimistat) for the treatment of older patients (at least 60 years of age) with relapsed/refractory acute myeloid leukemia (AML).
    • A Phase 3 study evaluating CPI-613 + chemo is currently recruiting patients. The estimated primary completion date is October 2022.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 6 Comments
  • EQIX

    Equinix extending data-center reach to Hamburg

    • Equinix (EQIX +2.2%) has closed a transaction that will let it extend its interconnection and data center services into Hamburg, Germany.
    • The company has bought a 130,000-square-foot commercial building from Aspen REG 1 for €9M, and plans to invest another €22M to redevelop the space in phase one.
    • It will rename the facility the Equinix HH1 International Business Exchange data center.
    • That marks Equinix's fourth market in Germany. It's expected to open for business in Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • EMMS

    Emmis Communications +11% post Q3 results

    • Emmis Communications (EMMS +11%) reported Q3 revenue decrease of 14.2% Y/Y to $30.32M.
    • Revenue by segments: Radio $28.7M (-15.5% Y/Y); Publishing $1.2M (+4.3% Y/Y) and Emerging technology $0.42M (+77.1% Y/Y).
    • Revenue by source: Advertising $20.8M (-13.3% Y/Y), Circulation $93k (-9.7% Y/Y), Nontraditional $3.1M (-13.9% Y/Y), LMA Fees $2.6M (flat Y/Y), Digital $1.5M (-37.5% Y/Y) and Other $2.3M (-14.8% Y/Y).
    • Q3 Operating income declined 30% Y/Y to $3M
    • Net cash used in operating activities was -$3.4M, compared to $3.1M a year ago.
    • Company has cash and equivalents of $4.1M.
    • Previously: Emmis Communications reports Q3 results (Jan. 10 2019)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • NOVN

    Novan seeking financing options; shares up 19%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Novan (NOVN +19%) is up on almost triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 218K shares. Shares have more than doubled since year-end.
    • Zack Investment Research recently upgraded the stock to Buy with a $1 price target (~40% below the current price).
    • In its corporate presentation, its cash balance at the end of September 2018 was $12.2M (slide #28), adding that cash on hand and upfront payments from the Sato agreement should be sufficient to fund operations into late Q2. Management says it is pursuing non-dilutive financing options.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • LGND

    Ligand Pharma get negative Grant's mention; shares down 6%

    • "Our contention is that Ligand’s (LGND -6.2%) shots are not so sure of the net as the Street would have it," says Grant's Interest Rate Observer in its latest issue.
    • Declining revenues could be in play after 2021 as the company's top treatments will face tougher competition, and the majority of new products under development are a decade away from commercialization.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 10 Comments
  • SCOR

    ComScore, Nexstar forge tighter ties as Nielsen alternative

    • ComScore (SCOR +1.3%) has a multi-year deal that expands its relationship with Nexstar Media Group (NXST +1.9%) -- a move that is another chip away at the measurement leadership of rival ratings firm Nielsen (NLSN +0.4%).
    • ComScore now serves as a currency and measurement provider to all Nexstar markets, including those acquired from Media General. It makes comScore the sole ratings provider for Nexstar stations in 97 of 100 markets, up from 51.
    • That includes a new cross-platform currency covering local linear TV, mobile, desktop and over-the-top.
    • As part of the deal, comScore is immediately accelerating the expansion of its over-the-air household panel.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 3 Comments
  • PLXP

    Amarin and Novan among healthcare gainers; Atossa Genetics and Axsome Therapeutics among losers

    • Gainers: PLx Pharma (NASDAQ:PLXP) +29%. Novan (NASDAQ:NOVN) +21%. Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) +14%. Rafael Holdings (NYSEMKT:RFL) +14%. Enochian Biosciences (OTCQB:ENOB) +12%.
    • Losers: Miragen Therapeutics (NASDAQ:MGEN) -19%. PAVmed (NASDAQ:PAVM) -16%. Atossa Genetics (NASDAQ:ATOS) -14%. Assembly Biosciences (NASDAQ:ASMB) -12%. Axsome Therapeutics (NASDAQ:AXSM) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 5 Comments
  • SPTN

    SpartanNash rallies after RBC Capital nod

    • RBC Capital initiates coverage on SpartanNash (SPTN +6.3%) with an Outperform rating on its expectation for improved profitability.
    • The firm assigns a Street-high price target of $25 to the food distributor.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • AMRN

    Amarin up 14% rekindled takeover chatter

    • Amarin (AMRN +13.8%) is up on average volume. Shares have rallied over 25% since year-end. Shares lost about half their value in November and December before reversing.
    • According to StreetInsider, Pfizer (PFE -2.3%) may interested in a bid.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 268 Comments
  • MGM

    MGM jumps on report of Starboard interest

    • MGM Resorts (MGM +2.7%) rallies off a Bloomberg report that Starboard Value is building a stake in the casino company and will push for changes.
    • Starboard has a pretty good track record of pushing its weight around the boardrooms of its targets.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 7 Comments

  • Natural gas inventory draw more than consensus

    • EIA Natural Gas Inventory: -87 Bcf vs. -76 Bcf consensus, -20 Bcf last week.
    • Futures +1.07% to $3.016.
    • ETFs: UNG, DGAZ, UGAZ, BOIL, KOLD, UNL
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 20 Comments
  • RELL

    Richardson Electronics down 9% on Q2 results

  • ERIC

    Ericsson taking $687M in Q4 charges; shares -4.4%

    • Ericsson (ERIC -4.4%) is taking charges of 6.1B kronor (about $687M) in its Q4 results in order to rearrange its Business Support System unit and cut losses there.
    • Of that amount, 3.1B kronor ($349M) is set for restructuring charges, the company says.
    • The Digital Services segment has yet to join the rest of the company in its turnaround, the company says, and that's jeopardizing the unit's overall profitability target for 2020.
    • The provisions mainly relate to estimated costs associated with expected changes in project scopes -- including customer compensation payments, provisions for project delays, and write-down of intangible assets.
    • The moves will "materially" cut losses in BSS as soon as this year. And the company anticipates another 1.5B kronor ($169M) in charges to come in 2019, including related headcount reductions.
    • More details will be provided along with earnings on Jan. 25.

  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond talks next-gen stores

    • Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY +5.6%) management outlined the company's next-gen store initiative during yesterday's post-earnings conference call.
    • "We have identified as many as 40 or so Bed Bath & Beyond stores that will become our working labs in support of our next generation store initiatives. In these lab stores, we are testing new and different assortments and visual merchandising and re-imagining the in-store experience to be able to further reinforce our position as the expert for the home and heartfelt life events," noted CEO Steven Temares.
    • "We are incorporating the learnings from our assortment strategy initiatives and other ongoing tests to assess where we can selectively and efficiently rollout these new experiences to a larger number of stores," he added.
    • Investors have bid up BBBY today following the company's earnings report, but bearish-leaning analysts at Wells Fargo and KeyBanc are still chipping away at the retailer for the underwhelming comparable sales growth (-1.8% vs. -0.3% consensus).

  • MDB

    Amazon comes for MongoDB; MDB -15%

    • MongoDB (NASDAQ:MDB) plunges 15% premarket after Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) announces its DocumentDB, a managed database that's compatible with existing MongoDB applications and tools.
    • The AWS database works with MongoDB version 3.6. 
    • Last fall, MongoDB announced that forthcoming releases of its open source product would carry a new SSPL license, which said anyone offering MongoDB as a cloud service also needed to make the resulting service open source. DocumentDB uses a version that predates the new license.
    • AWS wants to make it easier for its clients to use MongoDB and, as the dominant cloud player, could chip away at Mongo's user base.
